column1: Megion (Russian: Мегион) is a town in Khanty–Mansi Autonomous Okrug
column3: located at the altitude of 45 meters (148 ft) above sea level
column4: on the right bank of the Ob River
column5: 380 kilometers (240 mi) east of Khanty-Mansiysk and 760 kilometers (470 mi) northeast of Tyumen. The area of the town is 50.51 square kilometers (19.50 sq mi) and the nearest airport is in Nizhnevartovsk (30 kilometers (19 mi) away). Population: 49
column8: 783 (1989 Census).Combined with Nizhnevartovsk it is one of the most important industrial centres of oil producing.

column1: It was first mentioned in 1810. In 1961
column2: the first oil in Western Siberia was struck there. On September 29
column4: Megion was granted urban-type settlement status. On July 23
column6: it was elevated in status to that of a town. Now the town is a center of the oil and natural gas industries.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the town of okrug significance of Megion—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the town of okrug significance of Megion is incorporated as Megion Urban Okrug.
